Description

mdos, glud, mdos glud, glud rdzongs, b[s]lu, gto. These rituals employ effigies of various kinds. These are offered to spirits in return for the life or soul of the patron sponsoring the ritual. To the extent that they are counteracting the effects of malign spirits, they might be classed under exorcistic rites. The effigies are designated by such names as sku glud, sku ‘bag, glud tshab, glud gzugs, ngar glud, ngar mi, ‘dra glud, ‘dra gzugs, gzugs tshab. Should this be a category of its own (rather than under Exorcism)? Ex: Mdos dang glud kyi ‘phyong (W19133).

Secondary Sources

Mumford, Stan Royal. "Soul Calling of the Gurung Shaman." In Himalayan Dialogue: Tibetan Lamas and Gurung Shamans in Nepal, 169-175. Madison: University of Wisconsin Press, 1989.
